item.title: Powerline and ZSHâ€™s Agnoster theme in VS Code
item.description: Today I was installing Oh My ZSHand the theme Agnosterand it worked in the the normal terminal but not in Visual Studio Code's terminal, as it needs a monospaced font and Powerlineisn't one. In this post I'll explain how to quickly fix it. The problem ProblemVS Code defaults the terminal's font to the editor's font, and since the Agnoster theme needs Powerline, the terminal outputs non-sense characters.
